an8.20:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
an8.20:4.2: Now, at that time it was the sabbath, and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
an8.20:4.3: And then, as the night was getting on, in the first watch of the night, got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha and said:
an8.20:4.4: “Sir, the night is getting on. It is the first watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
an8.20:4.5: Please, sir, may the Buddha recite the Code to the mendicants.”
an8.20:5.1: But when he said this, the Buddha kept silent.
an8.20:5.2: For a second time, as the night was getting on, in the middle watch of the night, Ānanda got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha and said:
an8.20:5.3: “Sir, the night is getting on. It is the middle watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
an8.20:5.4: Please, sir, may the Buddha recite the Code to the mendicants.”
an8.20:5.5: But for a second time the Buddha kept silent.
an8.20:5.6: For a third time, as the night was getting on, in the middle watch of the night, Ānanda got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha and said:
an8.20:5.7: “Sir, the night is getting on. It is the last watch of the night and dawn stirs, bringing joy to the night.
an8.20:5.8: And the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
an8.20:5.9: Please, sir, may the Buddha recite the Code to the mendicants.”
an8.20:6.4: Then he focused on comprehending the minds of everyone in the Saṅgha.
an8.20:6.5: He saw that unethical person, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, secretive, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved, sitting in the middle of the Saṅgha.
an8.20:6.6: When he saw him he got up from his seat, went up to him
an8.20:6.8: “Get up, reverend. The Buddha has seen you.
an8.20:6.9: You can’t live in communion with the mendicants.”
an8.20:7.1: But when he said this, that person kept silent.
an8.20:7.9: But for a third time that person kept silent.
an8.20:8.1: Then venerable Mahāmoggallāna took that person by the arm, ejected him out the gate, and bolted the door. Then he went up to the Buddha,
an8.20:8.5: Please, sir, may the Buddha recite the Code to the mendicants.”
an8.20:8.7: how that foolish man waited to be taken by the arm!”
an8.20:9.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
an8.20:9.2: “Now, mendicants, you should perform the sabbath and recite the Code.
an8.20:9.3: From this day forth, I will not perform the sabbath or recite the Code.
an8.20:9.4: It’s impossible, mendicants, it can’t happen that a Realized One could recite the Code in an impure assembly.
an8.20:10.1: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things the demons love the ocean.
an8.20:10.3: The ocean gradually slants, slopes, and inclines, with no abrupt precipice,
an8.20:10.5: This is the first thing the demons love about the ocean. (Expand in detail as in the previous sutta.) …
an8.20:11.1: Furthermore, many great beings live in the ocean,
an8.20:11.3: leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies.
an8.20:11.4: In the ocean there are life-forms a hundred leagues long, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues long.
an8.20:11.11: This is the eighth thing the demons love about the ocean.
an8.20:11.12: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things the demons love the ocean.
an8.20:12.1: In the same way, seeing eight incredible and amazing things, mendicants, the mendicants love this teaching and training.
an8.20:12.3: The ocean gradually slants, slopes, and inclines, with no abrupt precipice,
an8.20:12.4: In the same way in this teaching and training the penetration to final knowledge comes from gradual training, progress, and practice, not abruptly.
an8.20:12.6: This is the first thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training. …
an8.20:12.7: Many great beings live in the ocean,
an8.20:12.9: leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies.
an8.20:12.10: In the ocean there are life-forms a hundred leagues long, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues long.
an8.20:12.11: In the same way, great beings live in this teaching and training,
an8.20:12.13: The stream-enterer and the one practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry. The once-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of once-return. The non-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of non-return. The perfected one, and the one practicing for perfection.
an8.20:12.19: This is the eighth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
an8.20:12.20: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things, the mendicants love this teaching and training.”
